history.narrative: Law 8-159 was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 8-579. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on May 15, 1990, and May 29, 1990, respectively. Approved without the signature of the Mayor on June 20, 1990, it was assigned Act No. 8-221 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.

meta.search-text: kwiktag 103 203 603 COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA NOTICE D.C. LAW 8-159 "Green Line Merchants Assistance Program Amendment Temporary Act of 1990 Pursuant to Section 412 of the District of Columbia Self- Government and Governmental Reorganization Act, P. L. 93-198 the Act the Council of the District of Columbia adopted Bill No. 8-579 on first and second readings, May 15, 1990, and May 29, 1990, respectively. The legislation was deemed approved without the signature of the Mayor on June 20, 1990, pursuant to Section 404(e) of "the Act and was assigned Act No. 8-221, published in the June 29, 1990, edition of the D.C. Register Vol. 37 page 4171) and transmitted to Congress on June 26, 1990 for a 30-day review, in accordance with Section 602(c)(I) of the Act. The Council of the District of Columbia hereby gives notice that the 30-day Congressional Review Period has expired, and therefore, cites this enactment as D.C. Law 8-159, effective September 14, 1990. Dates Counted During the 30-day Congressional Review Period: June 26,27,28,29 July 10,11,12,13,16,17,18,19,20,23,24,25,26,27,30,31 August 1,2,3 September 5,6,7,10,11,12,13 O.C.L W S" I 5=1 SEP t 41990 Enrolled Original Codification, District of Col~m%b~_a Code (1991 Suppleme~.t AN ACT D.C.ACT 8 1 IN THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA TO require, on a temporary basis, that the Office of Business and Economic Development expedite the loan/grant application process for retail businesses along the 7th and U Street Corridor. BE IT ENACTED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this act may be cited as the "Green Line Merchants Assistance Program Amendment Temporary Act of 1990 Sec. 2. The Business and Economic Development Act of 1976, effective March 29, 1977 (D.C. Law 1-97; D.C. Code, sec. 1-2201 e~t is amended by adding a new section 6a to read as follows Sec. 6a a) The Office shall process a loan/grant application under the MET Loan/Grant Program within 30 days of receipt of a loan/grant application b) The Director is authorized to approve the loan/grant application of any applicant without internal committee approval, if the loan/grant applicant meets the MET loan/grant requirements c) The Office shall make available reasonable resources to assist a loan/grant applicant in filing a loan/grant application. Reasonable resources shall include the services of a certified public accountant d) The Office shall work with the Department of Administrative Services DAS to devise a method for the Office to automatically assign a contract number to a MET loan/grant without special referral to DAS Sec. 3 a) This act shall take effect after a 30-day period of Congressional review following approval by the Mayor (or in the event of veto by the Mayor, action by the Council of the District of Columbia to override the veto) as provided in section 602(c)(i) of the District of Columbia Self-Government and Governmental Reorganization Act, approved December 24, 1973 (87 Stat. 813; D.C. Code, sec.
